No proof has ever been found of Shufelt’s city.

No tunnels. 
No gold. 
No tablets.

But the story lives in archived newspapers, mining documents, and Indigenous memory.

What he saw or believed he saw was enough to set off a government-sanctioned excavation.

Then?
Buried. https://t.co/CZZLVUhVg8
@putry_positiva @linera_io Mining pools optimize block rewards via hashrate aggregation

In 1934, an inventor claimed he found a vast underground city beneath Death Valley.

He filed official mining claims. The newspapers covered it.
Then he vanished.

No artifacts. 
No tunnels.

Just silence.

Let’s talk about the forgotten mystery of G. Warren Shufelt and the city https://t.co/ZrrvvfheaP
